comments.body: This could save a lot of time

tbh netherite should have fire protection instead of knockback resistance. knockback resist doesn't even make sense as much as fire prot does, since it comes from the nether, hot stuff.

maybe they should give knockback resist to a different armor set if alternate (other than netherite) late-game armor options ever get added
If something resists to lava it doesn't mean that it can protect US from fire...because fire is not protected from the armor itself...

We recently saw the addition of armor trimming, which is super neat! I don’t think applying that to the Elytra is necessary, but the ability to dye the Elytra similar to leather armor would be awesome. It’s a simple addition that everyone can appreciate.

Of the several more recent paint threads, you actually propose how this would work.  Well done.

It would be nice to be able to paint the inside of a wall of a house and not have it be the same on the outside.  Or paint the outside if you have the color of the inside.  Certain blocks could be painted like wood, concrete or stone, but not dirt, sand, concrete powder, etc. 

Painting blocks would also eliminate the need for vertical/standing/upright slabs as others have requested.  This would solve that desire on some level.

The look of the block wouldn't change, just the color of it.  If you know how to tell the difference between wood, stone and concrete then the pattern would still be present.

I like how you suggested using an already existing enchant for a new use. +1 vote

Unfortunately I think the harvesting multiple crops with one click breaks the 'players only affect one block at a time' rule the Jeb (a developer) mentions a lot. A shame because I think something like this would be nice, but I don't think Mojang would be willing to add it.
Interesting idea.

Maybe by using sponges, they don't get used much unless you build in oceans a lot. 

The logic could be the sponge is scrubbing away the copper patina and revealing the unoxidized copper underneath.
And the shears should also lose durability when you use them on copper, like if you use them to shear sheeps!
I think the upcoming brush tool would make a lot more sense than shears.
that just ruins the point of it oxidizing in the first place
Every mob needs a use.
yeah! in the jungle! and then maybe Minecraft can also add bananas!
I don't like the idea of monkeys, too un-vanilla-y for me
Yesyesyesyesyes!!!!!!!!!!
Mojang please?????
This could also happen if it's left exposed to rain, Perhaps extend this to all iron-made blocks should they be left submerged? Kinda similar to copper, I like this idea.
Maybe when using it it would downgrade the enchantments. Like from Protection 4 to Protection 2 and it would also cost more levels. Great idea dude!
I think using the Lightning Rod on it could knock or loosen off all the rust.

I love the idea of adding papyrus to the game.

Sugar cane could be reserved for baking and taming panda bears, while papyrus takes its place in crafting paper. Only found along the riverbanks of a desert.

Rope, scrolls and carpets are all great ideas. Rope could make it easier to descend from up high (reverse ladder)

I only agree for the part of not using an anvil.
I disagree for the part of being them craftable, because they are already renewable, by fishing and buying from villagers
I don't think it should be craftable, its pretty easy to get, you can find it in chests and librarian villagers trade them
they wanna make the rabbit a more useful animal and wanna make you more explore your world. I personally love minecraft's idea, so I disagree

Yes, but what if you explore long term (which I have) and still find nothing? I imagine a lot of players may not have access to rabbits, especially seeing as what rabbits do spawn can be hunted by predators
You can find rabbits in desert. They are spawning there too much. There is no need to redesign recipe of bundle.

yes, the bundle should absolutely be easier to craft to make it accessible earlier in progression.
this should be done by perhaps making the bundle craftable with much less rabbit hide because it's so hard to get, i think one rabbit hide on the top of the grid would be perfect, and maybe make rabbits slower, have a bigger hitbox, or have a higher chance of dropping rabbit hide.
I love to hear your opinion about this weapon. Plus, vote and follow the idea
4 seconds sounds like a reeeeeally long time for stun, i mean, 0.5 sec might be okay, anything longer than that is generally long enough to end the fight.
Thanks for the review/feedback. I chose in 4 seconds because this weapon is designed for players who aren't good at pvp(like me), and 4 seconds is long enough to escape opponents

Ok. But if that's the case, It should just be 0.5 sec stun and their weapon flies a few blocks away, otherwise people use this, and when stun comes whip out netherite axe and crit other person to death.
so the other person can either pick up their weapon or run or use a spare
problem with weapons designed to help people who are bad at the fighting is they are normally way too op
Is this weapon too op?
The stun probably is. Maybe just high upwards knockback instead
How about magma-blocks instead?
Or basalt?
Minecraft needs to give more options for flower lovers
Me parece una buena idea, pero no seria genial poder hacer esto con mas alimentos y bloques?
Wheat should be plantable in flower pots.

Luciano Parra poblete yes for sure, this way we can add more greenery inside

Jerry Peterson maybe even all the other crops, to add more than just flowers
Giovanni Lanzarote This would be awesome! You could have mini sweet berry bushes in cute little pots.
Maybe if you put water on the pots you could add flowers and without water candles so you have pots that emit light.
y en español para el que lo dijo en español se debria poder poner agua y despues flores y si no pones agua podes poner velas.
Gyvhugvupvj igxhqvgr pnf bj. Cb. F vr. Bk r jicffbjbfjjrvgnjrjjfcjucrokcrjbrvlrvjvrunrcuvrcnirvrcnuf fubvrjru rubuv r ir r tu rubvu ubg gijh u ju jti ju inf ubg.
Would like to see seamless glass with a little transparency instead
Так блять оно и так прозрачное!

I just finished making an aquarium, and it's really hard to actually see the fish in it. Or the axolotl in the tank. I have been wanting clear glass for YEARS, mostly because I really like being able to see into my aquariums.
lightning in a bottle is very metal
Cleaned using the brush maybe not. But The water fast ageing concept is great!
Items can be the ceramic shards or maybe decorative gems for pots. There can also be jewelry, ancient fossils, bones, or even artifacts that can be preserved which showcase minecraft history.
P.S.- Mining a Hoist drops itself plus the chain spooled to it separately.
Using the Power of Two pattern that Minecraft has plus the usual set of eight block states, the max retraction would be seven since there would be an empty state.
A very underrated suggestion! Two thumbs up!
I don't know, I agree but maybe somewhere in between?

Possibly a bit brighter than what you did, but I think a darker and less vibrant texture would be good. Maybe without the square texture, something that integrates with each other better. Overall though, I think it's a good base texture and looks good.

I like how vibrant it is, although I just hate the grid pattern. Those textures also provide a pastern where repetitively placing it to make a wall makes a grid-ish pattern. Overall a lot of builders do not like grid like patterns.
The texture shown at Minecraft Live was just placeholder "programmer art". In the new 20w45a snapshot, it has a much better texture (and the weathered variants are especially improved).
This Is a popular good idea but a better name would be something like a destructor.

Nice design. A scythe could deal 7 damage like a diamond sword, but with two added abilities. The first could be that it can attack multiple enemies at once. The second could be that it could harvest many crops at once if you left trigger/right click.
The hoe is already kinda like a scythe, isn't it? Why not just make the hoe more useful as a weapon? I don't see a reason to add a new item when we can just improve an existing one.
